meta.name: viewport
meta.title: Home Page - Carroll County School District

span.strong: Due to the Governor's order, Carroll County School District's schools will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019- 2020 school year. We will resume the Grab and Go feeding program April 27th. The program will be available on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday of each week through the remainder of the academic school year. Meals may be picked up in Blackhawk, at Vaiden Gym, or JZ George Gym in Carrollton. Third nine weeks report cards and learning packets will be available on April 27th at these locations as well. Due to FERPA regulations, only students or their parents or legal guardians are allowed to pick up report cards. No other family members or friends are allowed to pick these up. If you are unable to pick up your child's report card and would like it emailed or mailed to you, please email sjohnson@ccsd.ms or send a message through School Status to your child's homeroom teacher.

strong.span: Plans for end of year report cards, promotion and retention, and graduation ceremonies will come at a later date. Please be patient as we work through this storm. We know this is a difficult time for our staff, students, and parents but safety of our students is our first priority. We will miss our students greatly and look forward to seeing them all in the fall. Thank you for all you do for the children in Carroll County.

span.strong: Grab and Go meals will continue to be offered during this time of closure. Learning packets will be given out at meal pick up locations each day from 11-1 p.m.
If your child receives special education services, a learning packet will be mailed to you by the end of each week.

strong.span: Per the Governor's order, CCSD schools will be closed through April 17, 2020. Grab and Go meals will continue to be offered during this time of closure. Learning packets will be given out at meal pick up locations each Monday from 11-1 p.m. Teachers will be contacting students and parents about online activities. This situation is constantly changing. Please continue to follow our Facebook page and website. If you are a parent and not receiving the automated calls, please call the special services building tomorrow to update your phone number in our system. (662-237-4444)

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: School Feeding-1.jpg

p.span: This is an update from CCSD in reponse to updates on Covid 19. Carroll County Schools will extend spring holidays by one week in accordance with the governor's request in his address to the state. All schools will be closed March 16-20th. All school events, athletic competitions, and practices are cancelled at least through March 20th. District employees should check their emails regarding updates for work. Please check our Facebook page and website regularly for further updates.

div.p: The ACT will be given at JZ George High School on February 25, 2020, to the Junior class!
There will be no school on Monday, February 17, 2020.
Welcome back to school! We look forward to an amazing 3rd nine weeks! Report card pick up is this Thursday, January 9, 2019. Please come to the schools to pick up your child's report card!
Students will dismiss next Thursday, Dec. 19, 2019, at 12:00 p.m. School will resume on January 6, 2019.

After-School tutoring for grades 6-12 officially begins Monday, Oct. 28, 2019. Times are 3:15 to 5:15 p.m. Monday through Thursday, and 7:00 a.m. to 7:30 a.m. Monday and Tuesday mornings. Buses will run from the school site to designated drop off points. Drop off stops are the same, and snacks will be provided. Please contact Sherry Foster at 237-6840 or Sara Johnson at 237-4444 ext. 3 for further information.
The football game schedule this Friday against Bruce has been changed to Thursday due to the possibility of severe weather conditions. Come out and support our JAGS!!

div.h3: JZ George Band is headed to State Competition!

div.p: The J.Z. George High School Marching Band has officially qualified to go to the State Championship Competition in Pearl on Nov. 2, 2019. Let's wish our band GOOD LUCK with this major achievement!

We thank you for attending our 3rd Grade Literacy Night! We appreciate you for taking out time to meet with us, and we hope that we were able to provide some valuable information into your child's progress.
Congratulations to everyone that made the Honor Roll!!!
Get real time district updates on your mobile device with eChalk Notify.
Connect with code BFC6NA to get instant alerts or log in with your eChalk user account for the latest updates from all your classes and groups.
